In the meantime , on DATE the applicant trade union brought a civil claim against the company , seeking a judicial declaration that the resolution of the general meeting of staff approving the draft collective agreement was unlawful . CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the DATE LAW proscribes restrictions of rights or privileges on grounds of race , nationality , ethnic identity , sex , origin , religion , education , opinions , political affiliation , or personal , social or property status .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW provides that workers are free to form trade unions for the protection of their interests in relation to employment and social security .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW , as worded DATE and DATE , provided that in the exercise of their employment rights those concerned could not be subjected to direct or indirect discrimination , be granted privileges or be subjected to restrictions based on their nationality , sex , race , skin colour , age , political or religious convictions , membership in trade unions or other associations or movements , family , social or material status , or invalidity . An amendment which came into force on CARDINAL DATE slightly modified the wording of the provision and expanded the list of grounds of discrimination by adding to it origin , sexual orientation , psychological handicaps , and differences in the term of the employment contract or in the working time .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , as amended with effect from DATE , provides that trade unions represent workers before the authorities and employers and protect their rights in relation to employment , social security and the standard of living through , inter alia , collective bargaining , strike action or other lawful actions .
CARDINAL . Collective bargaining and collective agreements are governed by ORG CARDINAL of the Code , as amended with effect from DATE and then with effect from DATE .

CARDINAL . Collective agreements can be concluded at the level of the individual enterprise or at the level of the whole industry or sector ( Articles ORG and ORG ) . At the enterprise level , the collective agreement is concluded between the employer and the trade union(s ) in the enterprise ( LAW ) . CARDINAL collective agreement may exist in a given enterprise ( LAW ) . Its maximum duration is DATE ( LAW ) , and negotiations for the conclusion of a fresh collective agreement have to start not DATE before the expiry of the previous collective agreement ( LAW ) . The proposal for the agreement must emanate from the trade union(s ) in the enterprise . Unlike the position in relation to industrylevel or sectorlevel collective agreements ( LAW ) , for enterpriselevel agreements there is no requirement that the trade union(s ) which enter into them be “ representative ” . If in a given enterprise there exist several unions , they must come forward with a common draft proposal ( LAW ) . If they are unable to agree on one , the employer enters into an agreement with the union whose draft proposal has been approved by a majority of the general meeting of staff ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . By LAW ( CARDINAL ) , employers are under a duty to negotiate with the representatives of staff with a view to entering into a collective agreement . Their failure to do so gives rise to liability in damages ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) . ORG has held that the claim for damages may be brought by a trade union with which the employer has refused to negotiate ( see реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL октомври DATE г. по гр. д. № ORG г. , ORG , III г. о. ) . In the same judgment the court went on to say that , in the case of delayed negotiations , the compensation due under LAW should make good any damage resulting from the delay and should be assessed by reference to the terms of the collective agreement .

CARDINAL . A collective agreement is binding only on the workers who are members of a trade union which is party to the agreement ( LAW ) . Workers who are not members of such a union ( because they are members of another union or because they are not affiliated with any union ) may join the agreement by making a request in writing , under conditions laid down by the parties to the agreement ; those conditions can not contravene the law or good morals ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . The parties to the collective agreement or any worker to whom it applies may bring proceedings to seek its performance ( LAW ) or annulment ( LAW ) . ORG has consistently held that claims for annulment under LAW may be brought only by the parties to the agreement – the employer and the trade union(s ) DATE or by workers to whom it applies either because they are members of the trade unions which are party to the agreement or because they have subsequently joined it ( see опр. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL юни DATE г. по гр. д. № CARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , ORG , PERSON г. о. ; опр. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL декември DATE г. по гр. д. № CARDINAL г. , ORG , PERSON г. о. ; опр. № CARDINAL от DATE г. по гр.д. № DATE г. на ORG , ORG г. о. ; опр. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL юли DATE г. по гр. д. № CARDINAL г. , ORG , ORG г. о. ; and опр. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL юли DATE г. по гр. д. № DATE г. , ORG , GPE г. о. )

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that the Act applies to all individuals on the territory of GPE . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that associations of individuals and legal persons enjoy protection under the LAW if they have suffered discrimination by reason of their members or employees having one of the characteristics under section PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . NORP Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) , employers are bound to provide equal employment conditions without regard to the characteristics set out in section MONEY ) ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . The authority responsible for ensuring compliance with the LAW and with other statutes laying down equaltreatment provisions is ORG ( section CARDINAL ) . Section CARDINAL empowers the ORG to , inter alia , find a breach of the LAW ( point CARDINAL ) , order that the breach be discontinued and that the status quo ante be restored ( point CARDINAL ) , impose sanctions or order coercive measures ( point CARDINAL ) , or give mandatory instructions ( point CARDINAL ) . CARDINAL . Under section ORG ) , a person who has obtained a favourable decision by the ORG and seeks compensation for damage suffered as a result of the breach of its right to equal treatment stemming from the LAW or from other statutes can bring a claim for damages against the persons or authorities which have caused the damage . If the damage stems from unlawful decisions , actions or omissions of ORG authorities or officials , the claim must be brought under the ORG and ORG DATE ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) .

CARDINAL . Alternatively , instead of bringing proceedings before the ORG , a person who considers that the right to equal treatment stemming from the LAW or from other statutes has been breached can bring a civil claim , seeking declaratory or injunctive relief or an award of damages ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) . Trade unions can bring such claims on behalf of others ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW , headed “ The right to bargain collectively ” , provides as follows :
“ With a view to ensuring the effective exercise of the right to bargain collectively , the Parties undertake :
CARDINAL . NORP to promote joint consultation between workers and employers ;

CARDINAL . NORP to promote , where necessary and appropriate , machinery for voluntary negotiations between employers or ORG organisations and workers’ organisations , with a view to the regulation of terms and conditions of employment by means of collective agreements ;
CARDINAL . NORP to promote the establishment and use of appropriate machinery for conciliation and voluntary arbitration for the settlement of labour disputes ;
